definitions.definition: (of clothes) torn and not in good condition:
examples: The children were wearing dirty, ragged clothes.

definitions.definition: (of a person) untidy, dirty, and wearing old, torn clothes:
examples: Two ragged children stood outside the station, begging for money.

definitions.definition: (especially of an edge) rough and not smooth:
examples: The leaves of this plant have ragged edges.

definitions.definition: not performing well, because of not being organized:
examples: The team was rather ragged in the first half of the game.
